Data Path for your files (ATTENTION: Please always double check what you are deleting in the containers since this affects the files on your Server and you won't be able to recover them!!!
The recommended default path is /mnt/user)

JellyfinAMDIntelNvidia.Name: Jellyfin-AMD-Intel-Nvidia
JellyfinAMDIntelNvidia.Overview: Jellyfin is a Free Software Media System that puts you in control of managing and streaming your media. It is an alternative to the proprietary Emby and Plex, to provide media from a dedicated server to end-user devices via multiple apps..

Nvidia Visible Devices.Name: Nvidia Visible Devices
Nvidia Visible Devices.Description: Nvidia Visible Devices - enter your GPU UUID here (only required if you plan to use Nvidia hardware transcoding otherwise leave empty, don't forget to add '--runtime=nvidia' to your 'Extra Parameters' in the template).

Nvidia Driver Capabilities.Description: Nvidia Driver Capabilities (This value can be left in the template even if you don't want to use Nvidia hardware transcoding).

AMD or Intel Device.Name: AMD or Intel Device
AMD or Intel Device.Description: Path to AMD or Intel device - fill in with '/dev/dri' if you want to use AMD or Intel hardware transcoding (ATTENTION: Delete this entire entry with the Remove button if you don't want to use Intel or AMD hardware transcoding otherwise the container won't start).

Krusader.Name: Krusader
Krusader.Overview: Krusader is an advanced orthodox file manager for KDE and other desktops in the Unix world. It is similar to the console-based GNU Midnight Commander, GNOME Commander for the GNOME desktop environment, or Total Commander for Windows, all of which can trace their paradigmatic features to the original Norton Commander for DOS. It supports extensive archive handling, mounted filesystem support, FTP, advanced search, viewer/editor, directory synchronisation, file content comparisons, batch renaming, etc.

Locales - Language.Name: Locales - Language
Locales - Language.Description: Enter your prefered locales, you can find a full list of supported languages in: '/usr/share/i18n/SUPPORTED' simply open up a console from the Container and type in 'cat /usr/share/i18n/SUPPORTED' (eg: 'en_US.UTF-8 UTF8' or 'de_DE.UTF-8 UTF-8', 'fr_FR.UTF-8 UTF-8'...)

Run as root.Name: Run as root
Run as root.Description: Set this variable to 'true' if you want to run Krusader as root to edit system files (please remember you have to also change the Data Path to edit system level files)

Local Scaling.Name: Local Scaling
Local Scaling.Description: Delete this value if you don't want local scaling.

Data Path.Name: Data Path
Data Path.Description: Main data path to your unRAID shares (if you want to get access to a disk mounted through UnassignedDevices change the Host Path to '/mnt', if you want to get system level access change the Host Path to '/', you will then find the mounted path in Kruser in '/mnt/user').

MagicMirror2.Overview: This Container will download and install MagicMirror².

Force Modules Update.Name: Force Modules Update
Force Modules Update.Description: Set to 'true' (without quotes) to force an update on every restart of the container.

MEGASync.Name: MEGASync
MEGASync.Overview: MEGAsync is an intuitive application that enables you to effortlessly synchronize folders on several computers. You simply need to upload data in the cloud and, within seconds, you can explore the same documents on your own PC.

Host Path.Name: Host Path
Host Path.Description: Read only (This container was mainly created to backup files to MEGA, if you also want to sync files from and to MEGA please create a new path entry to the preferred share on the server - it's strongly recommended to do that in /mnt/... within the container)

Game Version.Name: Game Version
Game Version.Description: Preferred game version goes here (set to ‘latest’ to download the latest and check on every startup if there is a newer version available)

Extra Game Parameters.Name: Extra Game Parameters
Extra Game Parameters.Description: Extra startup Parameters if needed (leave empty if not needed)

UMASK.Name: UMASK
UMASK.Description: Permissions for newly created files. Don’t change unless you are knowing what you are doing!

MinecraftBasicServer.Name: MinecraftBasicServer
MinecraftBasicServer.Overview: This is a Basic Minecraft Server, with the basic configuration it will download and install a Vanilla Minecraft.

TCP - WebConsole.Name: TCP - WebConsole
TCP - WebConsole.Description: WebConsole (by default, you can connect to the Minecraft console by opening your browser and go to HOSTIP:9011 - eg: 192.168.1.1:9011 - or click on WebUI on the Docker page within Unraid).

Serverfile name.Name: Serverfile name
Serverfile name.Description: Enter your executable jar file (Minecraft Serverfile) withouat the .jar extension.

Game version.Name: Game version
Game version.Description: If you set the variable GAME_V to 'latest' the container will check on every restart if there is a newer version available (if set to 'latest' the variable JAR_NAME has to be 'server' - available options are 'latest', 'custom' or simply leave empty).

Extra Game Parameters.Name: Extra Game Parameters
Extra Game Parameters.Description: Enter your extra startup parameters otherwise leave blank!

Extra JVM Parameters.Name: Extra JVM Parameters
Extra JVM Parameters.Description: Enter your extra startup parameters for the JVM otherwise leave blank! (Only change if you know what you are doing!!!)

XMS Size.Name: XMS Size
XMS Size.Description: Enter your XMS size in MB (XMS=The initial and minimum heap size. It is recommended to set the minimum heap size equivalent to the maximum heap size in order to minimize the garbage collection.)

XMX Size.Name: XMX Size
XMX Size.Description: Enter your XMX size in MB (XMX=The maximum heap size. The performance will decrease if the max heap value is set lower than the amount of live data. It will force frequent garbage collections in order to free up space.)

Accept EULA.Name: Accept EULA

Maximum Clients.Description: Set the maximum number of connections to the game server.

Minimum Character Level.Name: Minimum Character Level
Minimum Character Level.Description: Set the minimum character level required by the server.

Maximum Character Level.Name: Maximum Character Level
Maximum Character Level.Description: Set the maximum character level allowed by the server.

Player Pause.Name: Player Pause
Player Pause.Description: Set if a player or DM can pause the game (0 = game can only be paused by DM, 1 = game can by paused by players)

PVP Mode.Name: PVP Mode
PVP Mode.Description: Set wich PVP mode do you want (0 = none, 1 = party, 2 = full)

Servercharacters Only.Name: Servercharacters Only
Servercharacters Only.Description: Set if local or server characters (0 = local characters only. 1 = server characters only)

Enforce Legal Characters.Name: Enforce Legal Characters
Enforce Legal Characters.Description: Set enforcing legal characters (0 = don't enforce legal characters, 1 = do enforce legal characters)

Enforce Item Level Restriction.Name: Enforce Item Level Restriction
Enforce Item Level Restriction.Description: Set enforcing item level restriction (0 = don't enforce item level restrictions, 1 = do enforce item level restrictions)

Multiple Parties Allowed.Name: Multiple Parties Allowed
Multiple Parties Allowed.Description: Set if one or more parties are allowed (0 = allow only one party, 1 = allow multiple parties)

Difficulty.Name: Difficulty
Difficulty.Description: Set difficutly (1 = easy, 2 = normal, 3 = D&D hardcore, 4 = very difficult)

Autosave Intervall.Name: Autosave Intervall
Autosave Intervall.Description: Set how frequently (in minutes) to autosave.  0 disables autosave.

Server Name.Name: Server Name
Server Name.Description: Set the name this server appears as in the mulitplayer game listing.

Connection Password.Name: Connection Password
Connection Password.Description: Set the password required by players to join the game.

Admin Password.Name: Admin Password
Admin Password.Description: Set the password required to remotely administer the game. Currently unused.

Public Server.Name: Public Server
Public Server.Description: Set if you want to list the game publicly (0 = do not list server with the matching service. 1 = list server with the matching service).

Restart Module If Server Becomes Empty.Name: Restart Module If Server Becomes Empty
Restart Module If Server Becomes Empty.Description: Restart module if server becomes empty (0 = module state is persistant as long as server is running, 1 = module state is reset when the server becomes empty).

RedM.Name: RedM
RedM.Overview: With this Docker you can run RedM (Red Dead Redemption 2 MOD SERVER) it will automatically download the latest version or if you want to updated it yourself set the ‘Manual Updates’ (in the 'Show more settings' tab down below) to ‘true’ (without quotes). The Docker will automatically extract it and download all other required files (resources, server.cfg). You can get fx.tar.xz from here: https://runtime.fivem.net/artifacts/fivem/build_proot_linux/master/ To run this container you must provide a valid Server Key (you can get them from here: https://keymaster.fivem.net/) and your prefered Server Name.

ConfigFile.Name: ConfigFile
ConfigFile.Description: You can edit the server.cfg after the first start (if you don't want to use the server.cfg then leave this field empty. For exampele: if you plan to use txAdmin you have to add another port in the template with the host and container port 40120, you then can connect to txAdmin with YOURSERVERIP:40120).

Manual Updates.Name: Manual Updates
Manual Updates.Description: Set this to 'true' without quotes to update your server manually (otherwise leave blank)

Restreamer.Name: Restreamer
Restreamer.Overview: Datarhei/Restreamer allows smart free video streaming in real time. Stream H.264 video of IP cameras live to your website. Pump your live video to YouTube-Live, Ustream, Twitch, Livestream.com or any other streaming-solutions e.g. Wowza-Streaming-Engine. Our Docker-Image is easy to install and runs on Linux, MacOS and Windows. Datarhei/Restreamer can be perfectly combined with single-board computers like Raspberry Pi and Odroid.

Port Variable.Name: Port Variable
Port Variable.Description: If you change this variable you have to create two new port forwardings with the corresponding ports one for TCP and one for UDP.

Static Secret.Name: Static Secret
Static Secret.Description: Create your own secret and enter it here or leave empty and the server creats a secret that is stored into 'secret.txt' in the main directory of the container (generate it for example in a linux terminal with the command 'openssl rand -hex 32' without quotes).

Certificate File Name.Name: Certificate File Name
Certificate File Name.Description: Name of the certification file (leave empty if the server should create one or replace it with your own).

Private Key File Name.Name: Private Key File Name
Private Key File Name.Description: Name of the private key file (leave empty if the server should create one or replace it with your own).

Diffie-Hellman Key File Name.Name: Diffie-Hellman Key File Name
Diffie-Hellman Key File Name.Description: Name of the Diffie–Hellman key file (leave empty if the server should create one or replace it with your own - also plase look under the 'Show more settings' tab if you want to generate a bigger or smaller key default is: 2048).

Display Secrets in log.Name: Display Secrets in log
Display Secrets in log.Description: Display your secrets in the log (set to 'true' or leave empty to disable it).

Certificate Generation - Country.Name: Certificate Generation - Country
Certificate Generation - Country.Description: Country code for your certificate if the server should create one (two letters eg: 'US' without quotes - also plase look under the 'Show more settings' tab there are more settings for generating your certificate).

Extra Startup Parameters.Name: Extra Startup Parameters
Extra Startup Parameters.Description: Here you can enter your Extra Startup Parameters if needed (you can get a full list of commands from here: https://github.com/coturn/coturn/wiki/turnserver)

Total Quota.Name: Total Quota
Total Quota.Description: Total allocations quota: global limit on concurrent allocations (only change if you know what you are doing).

Maximum bps.Name: Maximum bps
Maximum bps.Description: Max bytes-per-second bandwidth a TURN session is allowed to handle (input and output network streams are treated separately). Anything above that limit will be dropped or temporary suppressed - within the available buffer limits (only change if you know what you are doing).

Cipher List.Name: Cipher List
Cipher List.Description: Allowed OpenSSL cipher list for TLS/DTLS connections (only change if you know what you are doing).

Certificate Generation - Key Length.Name: Certificate Generation - Key Length
Certificate Generation - Key Length.Description: Enter your preferred key length (the higher the value the longer it takes to generate the certificate).

Certificate Generation - Valid Days.Name: Certificate Generation - Valid Days
Certificate Generation - Valid Days.Description: Specify how long that the certificate should be valid in days.

Diffie\u2013Hellman Key Length.Name: Diffie–Hellman Key Length
Diffie\u2013Hellman Key Length.Description: Enter your preferred key length (the higher the value the longer it takes to generate the key).

Command Line Password.Name: Command Line Password
Command Line Password.Description: Enter your CLI password or leave empty if you want that the server creates a random one (please note that you have to manually enable the console with the '--cli-port PORT' - PORT stands for your preferred port - in the Extra Startup Parameters and create the corresponding port).

Listening IP.Name: Listening IP
Listening IP.Description: Specify the listening port (only change if you know what you are doing).

Debuglevel.Name: Debuglevel

The variable is used to specify debug level. By default, value is 3. It is DebugLevel parameter in zabbix_server.conf. Allowed values are listed below:
0 - basic information about starting and stopping of Zabbix processes;
1 - critical information
2 - error information
3 - warnings
4 - for debugging (produces lots of information)
5 - extended debugging (produces even more information)

X11VNC_EXTRA_OPTS.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container. WARNING: For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

ENABLE_CJK_FONT.Name: ENABLE_CJK_FONT
ENABLE_CJK_FONT.Description: When set to 1, open-source computer font WenQuanYi Zen Hei is installed. This font contains a large range of Chinese/Japanese/Korean characters.

Storage to back up.Name: Storage to back up
Storage to back up.Description: This will be exposed to the Backblaze Client as drive D and therefore be backed up

bitnamiopenldap.Name: bitnami-openldap
bitnamiopenldap.Overview: Docker image to run Bitnami OpenLDAP. Check project site for configuration info

LDAP_USERS.Name: LDAP_USERS
LDAP_USERS.Description: Comma separated list of LDAP users to create in the default LDAP tree. Default: user01,user02

LDAP_PASSWORDS.Name: LDAP_PASSWORDS
LDAP_PASSWORDS.Description: Comma separated list of passwords to use for LDAP users. Default: password1,password2

LDAP_ENABLE_TLS.Name: LDAP_ENABLE_TLS
LDAP_ENABLE_TLS.Description: Whether to enable TLS for traffic or not. Defaults to no

LDAP_TLS_CERT_FILE.Name: LDAP_TLS_CERT_FILE
LDAP_TLS_CERT_FILE.Description: File containing the certificate file for the TSL traffic. No defaults. (container's relative path, e.g. /opt/bitnami/openldap/certs/openldap.crt)

LDAP_TLS_KEY_FILE.Name: LDAP_TLS_KEY_FILE
LDAP_TLS_KEY_FILE.Description: File containing the key for certificate. No defaults. (container's relative path, e.g. /opt/bitnami/openldap/certs/openldap.key)

LDAP_TLS_CA_FILE.Name: LDAP_TLS_CA_FILE
LDAP_TLS_CA_FILE.Description: File containing the CA of the certificate. No defaults. (container's relative path, e.g. /opt/bitnami/openldap/certs/openldapCA.crt)

LDAP_TLS_DH_PARAMS_FILE.Name: LDAP_TLS_DH_PARAMS_FILE
LDAP_TLS_DH_PARAMS_FILE.Description: File containing the DH parameters. No defaults.

LDAP_ROOT.Name: LDAP_ROOT
LDAP_ROOT.Description: LDAP database root node of the LDAP tree. Default: dc=example,dc=org

LDAP_USER_DC.Name: LDAP_USER_DC
LDAP_USER_DC.Description: DC for the users' organizational unit. Default: users

LDAP_GROUP.Name: LDAP_GROUP
LDAP_GROUP.Description: Group used to group created users. Default: readers

LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_ENABLED.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_ENABLED
LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_ENABLED.Description: Whether to create a configuration admin user. Default: no.

LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_USERNAME.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_USERNAME
LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_USERNAME.Description: LDAP configuration admin user. This is separate from LDAP_ADMIN_USERNAME. Default: admin.

LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_PASSWORD.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_PASSWORD
LDAP_CONFIG_ADMIN_PASSWORD.Description: LDAP configuration admin password. Default: configpassword.

LDAP_EXTRA_SCHEMAS.Name: LDAP_EXTRA_SCHEMAS
LDAP_EXTRA_SCHEMAS.Description: Extra schemas to add, among OpenLDAP's distributed schemas. Default: cosine, inetorgperson, nis

LDAP_SKIP_DEFAULT_TREE.Name: LDAP_SKIP_DEFAULT_TREE
LDAP_SKIP_DEFAULT_TREE.Description: Whether to skip creating the default LDAP tree based on LDAP_USERS, LDAP_PASSWORDS, LDAP_USER_DC and LDAP_GROUP. Default: no

LDAP_ULIMIT_NOFILES.Name: LDAP_ULIMIT_NOFILES
LDAP_ULIMIT_NOFILES.Description: Maximum number of open file descriptors. Default: 1024.

LDAP_ALLOW_ANON_BINDING.Name: LDAP_ALLOW_ANON_BINDING
LDAP_ALLOW_ANON_BINDING.Description: Allow anonymous bindings to the LDAP server. Default: yes

Log debug.Name: Log debug
Log debug.Description: Turn on debug info in logs

Certs folder path.Name: Certs folder path
Certs folder path.Description: Path to your certificates e.g. if you're using SWAG it would be /mnt/user/appdata/swag/keys

LDAP_CUSTOM_LDIF_DIR.Name: LDAP_CUSTOM_LDIF_DIR
LDAP_CUSTOM_LDIF_DIR.Description: Location of a directory that contains LDIF files that should be used to bootstrap the database. Only files ending in .ldif will be used. Default LDAP tree based on the LDAP_USERS, LDAP_PASSWORDS, LDAP_USER_DC and LDAP_GROUP will be skipped when LDAP_CUSTOM_LDIF_DIR is used. When using this will override the usage of LDAP_ROOT,LDAP_USERS, LDAP_PASSWORDS, LDAP_USER_DC and LDAP_GROUP.

LDAP_CUSTOM_SCHEMA_FILE.Name: LDAP_CUSTOM_SCHEMA_FILE
LDAP_CUSTOM_SCHEMA_FILE.Description: Location of a custom internal schema file that could not be added as custom ldif file (i.e. containing some structuralObjectClass). Default is /mnt/user/appdata/bitnami-openldap/custom.ldif

Media path.Name: Media path
Media path.Description: Same mapping as plex uses, for faster processing of files. CHANGE BOTH CONTAIER AND HOST MAPPING

It has full PMS connection awareness and allows you to connect locally, remotely, or even via relay.

SHARELATEX_SESSION_SECRET.Name: SHARELATEX_SESSION_SECRET
SHARELATEX_SESSION_SECRET.Description: A random string which is used to secure tokens, if load balancing this needs to be set to the same toke across boxes. If only 1 instance is being run it does not need to be set by the user.

SHARELATEX_SECURE_COOKIE.Name: SHARELATEX_SECURE_COOKIE
SHARELATEX_SECURE_COOKIE.Description: Set this to something non-zero to use a secure cookie. Only use this if your Overleaf instance is running behind a reverse proxy with SSL configured.

SHARELATEX_RESTRICT_INVITES_TO_EXISTING_.Name: SHARELATEX_RESTRICT_INVITES_TO_EXISTING_ACCOUNTS
SHARELATEX_RESTRICT_INVITES_TO_EXISTING_.Description: If set to true, will restrict project invites to email addresses which correspond with existing user accounts.

SHARELATEX_ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCESS.Name: SHARELATEX_ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCESS
SHARELATEX_ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCESS.Description: If set to 'true', will allow non-authenticated users to view the site. The default is false, which means non-authenticated users will be unconditionally redirected to the login page when they try to view any part of the site. Note, setting this option does not disable authentication or security in any way. This option is necessary if your users intend to make their projects public and have non-authenticated users view those projects.

SHARELATEX_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_READ_AND_WRIT.Name: SHARELATEX_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_READ_AND_WRITE_SHARING
SHARELATEX_ALLOW_ANONYMOUS_READ_AND_WRIT.Description: If set to 'true', will allow anonymous users to view and edit projects shared via the new link-sharing feature.

paperless.Name: paperless
paperless.Overview: Index and archive all of your scanned paper documents.
paperless.CAComment: While still functional, the author recommends to migrate to paperless-ng.

PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGE.Name: PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGE
PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGE.Description: Container Variable: PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGE . Override the language that tesseract will attempt to use when parsing documents. Use a 3-letter language code consistent with ISO 639: https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php

PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGES.Name: PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGES
PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGES.Description: Container Variable: PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGES . Additional languages to install for text recognition. Use a space separated list of 3-letter language codes consistent with ISO 639: https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php

PAPERLESS_FORGIVING_OCR.Name: PAPERLESS_FORGIVING_OCR
PAPERLESS_FORGIVING_OCR.Description:
Container Variable: PAPERLESS_FORGIVING_OCR . 
When true, Paperless will consume documents even if the language detection fails.

PAPERLESS_INLINE_DOC.Name: PAPERLESS_INLINE_DOC
PAPERLESS_INLINE_DOC.Description:
Container Variable: PAPERLESS_INLINE_DOC.
When true, PDF files will be viewed in the browser. When false (default), PDF files will be downloaded.

PAPERLESS_FILENAME_FORMAT.Name: PAPERLESS_FILENAME_FORMAT
PAPERLESS_FILENAME_FORMAT.Description: Specify a filename format for the document (directories are supported). Use the following placeholders: {correspondent}, {title}, {created}, {added}, {tags[KEY]} If your tags conform to key_value or key-value, {tags[INDEX]} If your tags are strings, select the tag by index. Uniqueness of filenames is ensured, as an incrementing counter is attached.

Data.Name: Data
Data.Description:
Container Path: /usr/src/paperless/data . 
This contains the paperless database. Should be in appdata.

Media.Name: Media
Media.Description:
Container Path: /usr/src/paperless/media . 
Once consumed, files will be stored here.

Consumption.Name: Consumption
Consumption.Description:
Container Path: /consume . 
Files placed here will be consumed by paperless.

Export.Name: Export
Export.Description:
Container Path: /export . 
Location for files used by the exporter utility.
See https://paperless.readthedocs.io/en/latest/utilities.html#the-exporter

plexweb.Name: plex-web
plexweb.Overview: PlexWeb is a web app for Plex servers. Connect to your server via your URL and token to access features like viewing current activity and adding playlists based on IMDb lists. Based on Flask.

PostGIS.Name: PostGIS
PostGIS.Overview: PostGIS is a spatial database extender for PostgreSQL object-relational database. The postgis/postgis image provides tags for running Postgres with PostGIS extensions installed.

PrivateBin.Name: PrivateBin
PrivateBin.Overview: A minimalist, open source online pastebin where the server has zero knowledge of pasted data. Data is encrypted/decrypted in the browser using 256 bits AES.

radarrsync.Name: radarrsync
radarrsync.Overview: RadarrSync Syncs two Radarr servers through web API. This is a modified version designed to be run in a docker container. This version supports only two servers.

rancher.Name: rancher
rancher.Overview: A container management platform built for organizations that deploy containers in production. The docker version of Rancher cannot be made HA (Highly Available), however the clusters it creates can be. It is also possible to connect to and use clusters created by rancher when it is down. Useful as a management interface for deploying, scaling, and editting apps on other systems. (in the cloud, a raspberry pi cluster, vms running k3os, etc.) Perfect for running and managing the apps that you'd rather not go down while maintaining your server.

RebuildDNDC.Name: Rebuild-DNDC
RebuildDNDC.Overview: - Rebuild Docker Network Dependent Containers, e.g. Monitor a VPN or any container and rebuild dependent containers using the VPN container network stack --net=container:vpn_cotnainer_name. [br]

RTMPSServer.Overview: This Docker image can be used to create a video streaming server that supports RTMP, RTMPS, HLS, DASH out of the box. It also allows adaptive streaming and custom transcoding of video streams. All modules are built from source on Debian and Alpine Linux base images.

searcharr.Name: searcharr
searcharr.Overview: Telegram Bot for Sonarr and Radarr

seedsync.Name: seedsync
seedsync.Overview: SeedSync is a tool to sync the files on a remote Linux server (like your seedbox, for example). It uses LFTP to transfer files fast!

seekerr.Name: seekerr
seekerr.Overview: Tool to add new movies to Radarr based on RSS, IMDB and Trakt lists. You need to create your config file before running the image. For more info on setup of your config file, check out: https://hub.docker.com/r/lightglitch/seekerr/

shinobiprocctv.Name: shinobi-pro-cctv

shokoserver.Name: shoko-server
shokoserver.Overview: Shoko server is the core component of the Shoko suite and with it's client-server architecture which allows any program or plugin to access Shoko. You'll have access to your entire collection locally and over the internet with no additional work outside the initial configuration required.

SiaDaemon.Name: Sia-Daemon
SiaDaemon.Overview: Sia is a decentralized cloud storage platform that radically alters the landscape of cloud storage. By leveraging smart contracts, client-side encryption, and sophisticated redundancy (via Reed-Solomon codes), Sia allows users to safely store their data with hosts that they do not know or trust. The result is a cloud storage marketplace where hosts compete to offer the best service at the lowest price. And since there is no barrier to entry for hosts, anyone with spare storage capacity can join the network and start making money.

speedtesttracker.Name: speedtest-tracker
speedtesttracker.Overview: This program runs a speedtest check every hour and graphs the results. The back-end is written in Laravel and the front-end uses React. It uses the speedtest-cli package to get the data and uses Chart.js to plot the results.

It works out-of-the-box with no or minimal configuration and provides a user friendly web console accessible using any web browser.

twonkyserver.Name: twonky-server

qbitmanage.Name: qbit_manage
qbitmanage.Overview: This is a program used to manage your qBittorrent instance such as:

QBT_CONFIG.Name: QBT_CONFIG
QBT_CONFIG.Description: This is used if you want to use a different name for your config.yml. Example: tv.yml

QBT_LOGFILE.Name: QBT_LOGFILE
QBT_LOGFILE.Description: This is used if you want to use a different name for your log file. Example: tv.log

QBT_RUN.Name: QBT_RUN
QBT_RUN.Description: Run without the scheduler. Script will exit after completion.

QBT_SCHEDULE.Name: QBT_SCHEDULE
QBT_SCHEDULE.Description: Schedule to run every x minutes. (Default set to 30)

QBT_CROSS_SEED.Name: QBT_CROSS_SEED
QBT_CROSS_SEED.Description: Use this after running cross-seed script to add torrents from the cross-seed output folder to qBittorrent

QBT_RECHECK.Name: QBT_RECHECK
QBT_RECHECK.Description: Recheck paused torrents sorted by lowest size. Resume if Completed.

QBT_CAT_UPDATE.Name: QBT_CAT_UPDATE
QBT_CAT_UPDATE.Description: Use this if you would like to update your categories.

QBT_TAG_UPDATE.Name: QBT_TAG_UPDATE
QBT_TAG_UPDATE.Description: Use this if you would like to update your tags. (Only adds tags to untagged torrents)

QBT_REM_UNREGISTERED.Name: QBT_REM_UNREGISTERED
QBT_REM_UNREGISTERED.Description: Use this if you would like to remove unregistered torrents. (It will the delete data & torrent if it is not being cross-seeded, otherwise it will just remove the torrent without deleting data)

QBT_REM_ORPHANED.Name: QBT_REM_ORPHANED
QBT_REM_ORPHANED.Description: Use this if you would like to remove orphaned files from your root_dir directory that are not referenced by any torrents. It will scan your root_dir directory and compare it with what is in qBittorrent. Any data not referenced in qBittorrent will be moved into /data/torrents/orphaned_data folder for you to review/delete.

QBT_TAG_NOHARDLINKS.Name: QBT_TAG_NOHARDLINKS
QBT_TAG_NOHARDLINKS.Description: Use this to tag any torrents that do not have any hard links associated with any of the files. This is useful for those that use Sonarr/Radarr that hard links your media files with the torrents for seeding. When files get upgraded they no longer become linked with your media therefore will be tagged with a new tag noHL. You can then safely delete/remove these torrents to free up any extra space that is not being used by your media folder.

QBT_SKIP_RECYCLE.Name: QBT_SKIP_RECYCLE
QBT_SKIP_RECYCLE.Description: Use this to skip emptying the Reycle Bin folder (/root_dir/.RecycleBin).

QBT_DRY_RUN.Name: QBT_DRY_RUN
QBT_DRY_RUN.Description: If you would like to see what is gonna happen but not actually move/delete or tag/categorize anything.

radarrsma.Name: radarr-sma

This comes bundled with sickbeard_mp4_automator script, that can be found here: https://github.com/mdhiggins/sickbeard_mp4_automator[br][br][b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Nvidia GPU Use[/span][/u][/b][br]Using the Unraid Nvidia Plugin to install a version of Unraid with the Nvidia Drivers installed and[br] add [b]--runtime=nvidia[/b] to [b]"extra parameters"[/b] (switch on advanced view) and[br]copy your [b]GPU UUID[/b] to [b]NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES.[/b][br][br][b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Intel GPU Use[/span][/u][/b][br]Edit your [b]go[/b] file to include:[br][b]modprobe i915[br][/b], save and reboot, then [br]add [b]--device=/dev/dri[/b] to [b]"extra parameters"[/b] (switch on advanced view)

sabnzbdextended.Name: sabnzbd-extended
sabnzbdextended.Overview: SABnzbd makes Usenet as simple and streamlined as possible by automating everything we can. All you have to do is add an .nzb. SABnzbd takes over from there, where it will be automatically downloaded, verified, repaired, extracted and filed away with zero human interaction.[br]

derbynetserver.Name: derbynet_server
derbynetserver.Overview: DerbyNet is the new standard in race management software for Pinewood Derby events. It's free, and it's open source. With DerbyNet, multiple browsers connect to a web server running on your laptop or in the cloud.
derbynetserver.CAComment: This template is set up to use a custom network. You may have to adjust the network or IP address etc to match your system

Secure Webserver Port (Self Signed Certs.Name: Secure Webserver Port (Self Signed Certs)
Secure Webserver Port (Self Signed Certs.Description: The docker has a secure webportal but the certificates are self signed.

Timer Password.Name: Timer Password
Timer Password.Description:
The Timer role is intended for use by the derby-timer.jar program running on the remote timer device connected to the track (raspberrypi). 

By default, the Timer user has an
empty password, so it is not necessary to enter any password in derby-timer.jar. However, this
password, like all passwords should be updated to secure the server.

Note: The password must match the password set for TIMER_PASSWORD in the timer device (raspberrypi) /etc/derbynet.conf file.

Race Crew Password.Name: Race Crew Password
Race Crew Password.Description:
RaceCrew, password “murphy” (as in Don Murphy, not Murphy’s Law): this role can do things
like check racers in, but not erase the database.

Race Coordinator Password.Name: Race Coordinator Password
Race Coordinator Password.Description:
RaceCoordinator, password default is “doyourbest” 

This role can do anything at all.

Photo Password.Name: Photo Password
Photo Password.Description:
You can upload photos to the web server via HTTP, using the Photo role. The default password for the Photo role is “flashbulb.”

For an example of this, see extras/photostand/photostand.sh, a shell script for automated photo capture.
(More description at http://www.derbytalk.com/viewtopic.php?f=25&t=8253.)

streetmerchant.Name: streetmerchant
streetmerchant.Overview: This service is a automated stock checker primarily focused on CPUs, GPUs, and Console Gaming Systems that has an abundance of mechanisms to notify your user group when items are available to include a link to add to an online cart.

EMAIL_TO.Description: Destination Email. Defaults to username if not set. Can be comma separated

EMAIL_PASSWORD.Name: EMAIL_PASSWORD
EMAIL_PASSWORD.Description:
Email password. (See below for Gmail MFA users)

If you use Gmail and have multi-factor authentication (MFA), you will need to create an app password and use this instead of your Gmail password.

https://myaccount.google.com/apppasswords

PHONE_CARRIER.Description:
Supported carriers for SMS. E.g.: att or att,verizon,google, email configuration required. If multiple phone numbers are listed, enter a carrier for each phone number.

https://jef.codes/streetmerchant/reference/notification/#supported-carriers

PHONE_NUMBER.Name: PHONE_NUMBER
PHONE_NUMBER.Description: 10 digit phone number(s). E.g.: 1234567890 or 1234567890,0987654321,11112223333, email configuration required.

SHOW_ONLY_BRANDS.Description:
Filter to show specified brands. Comma separated, e.g.: evga,zotac

https://jef.codes/streetmerchant/reference/filter/

SHOW_ONLY_SERIES.Name: SHOW_ONLY_SERIES
SHOW_ONLY_SERIES.Description:
Filter to show specified series. Comma separated, e.g.: 3080,ryzen5900

https://jef.codes/streetmerchant/reference/filter/

SHOW_ONLY_MODELS.Name: SHOW_ONLY_MODELS
SHOW_ONLY_MODELS.Description: Filter to show specified models	Both supported formats are comma separated

STORES.Name: STORES
STORES.Description:
Supported stores you want to be scraped. Default: amazon,bestbuy. Comma separated, can include PAGE_SLEEP_MIN and PAGE_SLEEP_MAX values. E.g.: amazon:10000:30000,bestbuy,newegg:50000:80000.

https://jef.codes/streetmerchant/reference/filter/#supported-stores

AUTO_ADD_TO_CART.Name: AUTO_ADD_TO_CART
AUTO_ADD_TO_CART.Description:
Future Feature. Not available yet.

Enable auto add to cart on support stores, default: true

BROWSER_TRUSTED.Name: BROWSER_TRUSTED
BROWSER_TRUSTED.Description: Skip Chromium Sandbox. Set to true for containerized environments,

icloudpd.Name: icloudpd
icloudpd.Overview: iCloudPD, Alpine Linux Docker container wrriten by [a href="https://github.com/boredazfcuk"]boredazfcuk[/a], syncs photos from iDevices to a single directory on Unraid. It uses the system keyring to securely store credentials, has HEIC to JPG conversion capability, and supports Telegram, Prowl, PushBullet and WebHook notifications.

Apple ID.Name: Apple ID
Apple ID.Description: This is the Apple ID for the account you want to download files from

Notification Type.Name: Notification Type
Notification Type.Description: This specifies the method that is used to send notifications. Currently, there are three options available 'Prowl', 'Pushbullet' and 'Telegram'. When the two factor authentication cookie is within 7 days (default) of expiry, a notification will be sent upon synchronization. No more than a single notification will be sent within a 24 hour period unless the container is restarted. This does not include the notification that is sent each time the container is started

Prowl API Key.Name: Prowl API Key
Prowl API Key.Description: If the notification_type is set to 'Prowl' this is mandatory. This is the API key for your account as generated by the Prowl website

Pushbullet API Key.Name: Pushbullet API Key
Pushbullet API Key.Description: If the notification_type is set to 'Pushbullet' this is mandatory. This is the API key for your account as generated by the Pushbullet website

Telegram Token.Name: Telegram Token
Telegram Token.Description: If the notification_type is set to 'Telegram' this is mandatory. This is the token that was assigned to your account by The Botfather

Telegram Chat ID.Name: Telegram Chat ID
Telegram Chat ID.Description: If the notification_type is set to 'Telegram' then this is the chat_id for your Telegram bot

Command Line Options.Name: Command Line Options
Command Line Options.Description: This is for additional command line options you want to pass to the icloudpd application. https://github.com/ndbroadbent/icloud_photos_downloader#usage

Pomerium.Name: Pomerium
Pomerium.Overview: Pomerium is an identity-aware proxy that enables secure access to internal applications. Pomerium provides a standardized interface to add access control to applications regardless of whether the application itself has authorization or authentication baked-in. Pomerium gateways both internal and external requests, and can be used in situations where you'd typically reach for a VPN. Check ports to ensure you do not have conflicts. **NOTE** You MUST: 1.Create a config.yaml file in appdata/pomerium/pomerium. The parameters for the file can be found here: https://www.pomerium.io/reference/ 2. Match your cookie secret in both the file and the variable below.

pterodactyldaemon.Name: pterodactyl-daemon
pterodactyldaemon.Overview: Pterodactyl is an open-source game server management panel built with PHP 7, React, and Go. Designed with security in mind, Pterodactyl runs all game servers in isolated Docker containers while exposing a beautiful and intuitive UI to end users.

Its main goal is to be an aid for security professionals to test their skills and tools in a legal environment, help web developers better understand the processes of securing web applications and to aid both students & teachers to learn about web application security in a controlled class room environment.

OpenVPNHyRoSa.Name: OpenVPN-HyRoSa
OpenVPNHyRoSa.Overview: OpenVPN Client with integrated (NZB)Hydra2-RTorrent (Flood GUI)-Sabnzbd (and HTTP + SOCKS5 proxies). Now with a Web GUI quick launch.

FireflyIII.Name: Firefly-III
FireflyIII.Overview: "Firefly III" is a (self-hosted) manager for your personal finances. It can help you keep track of your expenses and income, so you can spend less and save more. Firefly III supports the use of budgets, categories and tags. Using a bunch of external tools, you can import data. It also has many neat financial reports available.

PORT.Name: PORT
PORT.Description: The port the Bot will use for incoming Socket.io communications from the capture client. Defaults to 8123. You must specify more (comma-delimited ports) if you are running with NUM_SHARDS > 1. For example, with 3 shards, PORT = 8123,8124,8125

DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN.Name: DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN
DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN.Description: The Bot Token used by the bot to authenticate with Discord.

HOST.Name: HOST
HOST.Description: The externally-accessible URL for this instance of the discord bot. For example, http://test.com:8123 (NOTE: The EXTERNAL PORT of the bot must be included at the end of the URL This is used to provide the linking URI to the capture, via the Direct Message the bot sends you when typing .au new (in conjunction with the PORT above). You must specify http:// or https:// accordingly as part of the URL

DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN_2.Name: DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN_2
DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN_2.Description: (Optional) A second Bot Token to be used to distribute the mute/deafen requests to Discord. If you play in larger groups of 8+ people, this is recommended to not be rate-limited (delayed) by Discord when rounds change!

NUM_SHARDS.Name: NUM_SHARDS
NUM_SHARDS.Description: How many total bot shard instances you'll be running in your current stack.

LOG_PATH.Name: LOG_PATH
LOG_PATH.Description: The path where the bot will store it's log files

Domains.Name: Domains

Base URL.Name: Base URL
Base URL.Description: The URL path for WebDAV (eg, if set to /webdav then clients should connect to example.com/webdav). The default is /.

Authentication.Name: Authentication

Login Title.Name: Login Title

Username.Name: Username
Username.Description: Authenticate with this username (and the password below). Will be ignored if /user.passwd is present.

Password.Name: Password

Public methods.Name: Public methods
Public methods.Description: Comma-separated list of HTTP request methods (eg, GET,POST,OPTIONS,PROPFIND) which can be used without login. The default is to disallow any anonymous access.

Enable SSL.Name: Enable SSL
Enable SSL.Description: Set to selfsigned to generate a self-signed certificate and enable Apache's SSL module. If you specify SERVER_NAMES, the first domain is set as the Common Name.

roundcubevermariadb.Name: roundcube-ver-mariadb
roundcubevermariadb.Overview: Roundcube Webmail is a browser-based multilingual IMAP client with an application-like user interface. It provides full functionality you expect from an email client, including MIME support, address book, folder management, message searching and spell checking. Roundcube Webmail is written in PHP and requires the MySQL, PostgreSQL or SQLite database. With its plugin API it is easily extendable and the user interface is fully customizable using skins.

trango.Name: trango
trango.Overview: Trango self-hosted is a calling and file sharing solution that works over LAN (local area networks). It does not need to involve the internet for calling or file sharing. Ideal for offices, hotels, houses, restaurants, and any space where people use the same Public IP address or the same Wi-Fi network. The package comes with a discovery server and a web app that can be deployed on the local machine and can be accessed from anywhere in the network.

Token.Description: Get your token from https://github.com/settings/tokens, see the support page for more details.

Schedule.Name: Schedule
Schedule.Description: How often to sync in seconds (eg. 3600 for 1h, 21600 for 6h, 43200 for 12h, 86400 for 24h)

Backup location.Name: Backup location
Backup location.Description: Set the location of your github backups. Please note that the default will create a backup share if it does not exist and you don't change it.

PhoenixMiner.Name: PhoenixMiner
PhoenixMiner.Overview: Containerised version of PhoenixMiner. Helps turn your Unraid server into an Ethereum / cryptocurrency mining rig. Contains AMD drivers. Not affected by the AMD reset bug as it doesn't rely on vfio. Works with most Nvidia GPUs as well via Open Source drivers. Check the support link for detailed installation instructions.

WebUI.Name: WebUI
WebUI.Description: Used for basic monitoring over http/https built into PhoenixMiner

Wallet Address.Name: Wallet Address
Wallet Address.Description: Wallet address for receiving mined coin

Pool Password.Name: Pool Password
Pool Password.Description: Most pools just use 'x' as password, some pools treat this variable as a worker ID

Safety: Target Temperature.Name: Safety: Target Temperature
Safety: Target Temperature.Description: Target temperature for fans (only works if privileged mode is enabled)

Safety: Stop Temperature.Name: Safety: Stop Temperature
Safety: Stop Temperature.Description: PhoenixMiner will pause mining on a GPU if it hits this temperature (only works if privileged mode is enabled)

Safety: Resume Temperature.Name: Safety: Resume Temperature
Safety: Resume Temperature.Description: PhoenixMiner will resume mining on a GPU if it hits this temperature after being paused (only works if privileged mode is enabled)

AMD Driver Version.Name: AMD Driver Version
AMD Driver Version.Description: Leave this variable alone unless you have a reason to change to a different driver version. Options for AMD are '18.20', '20.20', '20.45', '20.50'; '20.20' is recommended for everyone unless you have a 6800XT or 6900XT in which case choose '20.45'. The other options are for testing purposes only. Nvidia cards should work regardless of the option chosen here, but you can enter '0' to remove the default AMD drivers on launch if you really want to.

Nvidia Visible Devices.Name: Nvidia Visible Devices
Nvidia Visible Devices.Description: Nvidia Only: Enter your GPU UUID here (only required if you plan to mine with an Nvidia GPU otherwise leave this empty. Don't forget to add '--runtime=nvidia' to your 'Extra Parameters' in the Advanced View).

Nvidia Driver Capabilities.Name: Nvidia Driver Capabilities
Nvidia Driver Capabilities.Description: Please leave this set to the default option of 'all' if you aren't sure what to put here. This value can be left in the template even if you don't want to mine with an Nvidia GPU.

GPU Device.Name: GPU Device
GPU Device.Description: GPU passthrough from host to container. This Isn't necessary if privileged mode is enabled, but won't hurt.

PhoenixStats.Name: PhoenixStats
PhoenixStats.Overview: Simple container for displaying stats from any PhoenixMiner instance. Made to go with PhoenixMiner-AMD.

Server Name.Name: Server Name
Server Name.Description: Server name for miner (Can be set to anything)

Miner Port.Name: Miner Port
Miner Port.Description: Port shared by miner over http (usually 5450)

XMRig.Name: XMRig
XMRig.Overview: Containerised version of XMRig for CPU Mining. Helps turn your Unraid server into a Monero / cryptocurrency mining rig. Now optionally works with GPU algorithms as well.

Pool.Name: Pool
Pool.Description: Address for your mining pool. Eg. 'xmr-au1.nanopool.org:14444'

Wallet.Name: Wallet
Wallet.Description: Wallet address for receiving mined coin. If you are privacy conscious, you can redact this in logs posted to the support thread by replacing it with *****WALLET*****. If you use Monero, sharing this address will only allow people to send you Monero and possibly identify you if you send someone else Monero, but being a privacy oriented coin it's entirely up to you.

Worker name.Name: Worker name
Worker name.Description: Enter a name for your worker. Some pools use a hidden option with this (Nanopool included) that allows you to change your payment threshold on their website. If you want to use this option, you can change this to 'workername/email', eg. 'Unraid/test@example.com', where test@example.com is your own email address. This option is basically a password. Please take note that if you post your logs in the support thread you would be best to redact the email address, eg. change out the instances of your email with ***@***.*** to prevent your email address being posted in a public forum.

Additional XMRig Arguments.Name: Additional XMRig Arguments
Additional XMRig Arguments.Description: Please leave '--no-colour', as Unraid's webUI log viewer does not respond well to this option being disabled. | If you plan on using an AMD card for GPU mining, please add '--opencl'; the field would then read '--no-colour --opencl', please don't miss the variables below. | If you plan on using an Nvidia card for GPU mining, please add '--cuda'; the field would then read '--no-colour --cuda'

Donation %.Name: Donation %
Donation %.Description: % that you would like to donate. Enter a whole number between 0-100, no symbols.

Donation to.Name: Donation to
Donation to.Description: Select where you would like to donate the developer fee. Options are 'dev-fee', 'lnxd-fee' and 'no-fee'.

Coin.Name: Coin
Coin.Description: Select a coin to mine. Options are 'monero', 'arqma' and 'dero'. You can optionally disable this to use the '--algo' flag in Additional XMRig Arguments by setting this to 'x'.

GPU Driver Version.Name: GPU Driver Version
GPU Driver Version.Description: Please note: while you *can* mine Monero with a GPU, it is designed to be mined with a CPU. If you have a GPU, please confirm it is not more profitable to mine a currency that does not intentionally bottleneck GPU mining. | Set '20.20' for AMD, other options are for testing purposes only ('18.20', '20.45', '20.50'). If you have an Nvidia card, enter 'CUDA' | Please note that this container will not work with both AMD Drivers and Cuda installed at the same time. if you want to do this, please set this container up for one and create a second, separate container for the other. | Please also note that if you use the 'CUDA' value, the container will end up around 3gb in size and take a very long time to start after updates.

Nvidia Visible Devices.Name: Nvidia Visible Devices
Nvidia Visible Devices.Description: Nvidia Only: Enter your GPU UUID here (only required if you plan to mine with an Nvidia GPU otherwise leave this empty. Don't forget to add '--runtime=nvidia' to your 'Extra Parameters' in the Advanced View).

Nvidia Driver Capabilities.Name: Nvidia Driver Capabilities
Nvidia Driver Capabilities.Description: Please leave this set to the default option of 'all' if you aren't sure what to put here. This value can be left in the template even if you don't want to mine with an Nvidia GPU.

GPU Device.Name: GPU Device
GPU Device.Description: *Important* You can remove this if you don't want to use GPU passthrough from host to container. Set it to '/dev/dri:/dev/dri' if you want to use your GPU. This Isn't necessary if privileged mode is enabled, but won't hurt to have it enabled anyway.

Jellyfinvuessr.Name: Jellyfin-vue-ssr
Jellyfinvuessr.Overview: A modern web client for Jellyfin based on Vue. It relies on Jellyfin to store and manage your media. This version uses server side rendering for improved performance.

Jellyfinvuestatic.Name: Jellyfin-vue-static
Jellyfinvuestatic.Overview: A modern web client for Jellyfin based on Vue. It relies on Jellyfin to store and manage your media.

alpacatoinfluxdb.Name: alpaca-to-influxdb
alpacatoinfluxdb.Overview: Alpaca to Influx is a container designed to be run on an [Unraid](https://www.unraid.net/) server via Docker. The purpose of the container is to simplify the ingestion of stock market data, provided by the [Alpaca API](https://alpaca.markets/), into your own [Influx database](https://www.influxdata.com/).

binancetoinfluxdb.Name: binance-to-influxdb
binancetoinfluxdb.Overview: Binance to Influx is a container designed to be run on an [Unraid](https://www.unraid.net/) server via Docker. The purpose of the container is to simplify the ingestion of cryptocurrency market data, provided by the [Binance API](https://binance.com/), into your own [Influx database](https://www.influxdata.com/).

s3sync.Name: s3sync
s3sync.Overview: This application backs up every folder mounted at `/data/` to a given AWS S3 path using the `aws s3 sync` command. It requires a pair of (IAM) Access and Secret Keys.

S3 Sync Parameters.Name: S3 Sync Parameters
S3 Sync Parameters.Description: (Optional) Extra parameters for the s3 sync command.

S3 Path.Name: S3 Path
S3 Path.Description: The target bucket path with optional prefix.

Backup Source Example.Name: Backup Source Example
Backup Source Example.Description: This folder will be backed up.

IPMITools.Name: IPMI-Tools
IPMITools.Overview: This is a container with a webGUI to manage a Dell servers fan speeds using IPMI. You must enable IPMI from iDRAC. You can pass credentials through environment variables or enter them in the webGUI at runtime.

IPMI Host.Name: IPMI Host
IPMI Host.Description: The IP or host of your iDRAC interface.

IPMI User.Name: IPMI User
IPMI User.Description: Your IPMI username (same as your iDRAC user)

IPMI Password.Name: IPMI Password
IPMI Password.Description: Your IPMI password (same as your iDRAC password)

NamecheapDDNS.Name: Namecheap-DDNS
NamecheapDDNS.Overview: This simple container will update a namecheap dynamic dns domain. You must set an 'A + Dynamic DNS Record' for the host and enable Dynamic DNS in the manage page for your domain.

HOST.Name: HOST
HOST.Description: This is the host to be updated. e.g. 'www.'

DOMAIN.Name: DOMAIN
DOMAIN.Description: This is the domain to be updated. e.g. yourdomain.tld

PASSWORD.Name: PASSWORD
PASSWORD.Description: Your Dynamic DNS password. NOT your namecheap password.

BigbenDiscord.Name: Bigben-Discord
BigbenDiscord.Overview: Big Ben Clock Discord-Bot is an self-hosted (useless) Discord Bot, that joins every Hour in an pre selected Voice channel, and plays the Big Ben Bells, to inform you, that you have entered an new Hour.

BOT_TOKEN.Name: BOT_TOKEN
BOT_TOKEN.Description: Get an Bot-Token from the Discord Developer Portal and Enter it here

DATABASE_URL.Name: DATABASE_URL
DATABASE_URL.Description: Change the URL to your PostgreSQL host, to get it working

neko.Name: neko
neko.Overview: Neko is an Open-Source self-hosted Alternative to rabb.it(deprecated).

NEKO_NAT1TO1.Name: NEKO_NAT1TO1
NEKO_NAT1TO1.Description: Enter the IP of your Unraid-Server

Win11inReact.Name: Win11-in-React
Win11inReact.Overview: Windows 11 in React is an Windows 11 Web-Clone in React.

remotely.Name: remotely
remotely.Overview: A remote control and remote scripting solution, built with .NET 5, Blazor, SignalR Core, and WebRTC.

telethondownloader.Name: telethon-downloader
telethondownloader.Overview: This is a simple container that downloads files sent to a telegram bot up to 2000mb using the Telethon library.

machinarischiaharvester.Name: machinaris-chia-harvester
machinarischiaharvester.Overview: On a secondary Unraid system, allows for harvesting of local Chia plots.  Connects to the main Machinaris application.

plots_dir.Name: plots_dir
plots_dir.Description: A colon-separated list of all in-container paths (defined above) holding your completed plots.  Example: /plots1:/plots2:/plots3

controller_host.Name: controller_host
controller_host.Description: The IP address of the Machinaris Controller on your LAN for controller/worker communication. ANOTHER COMPUTER

farmer_address.Name: farmer_address
farmer_address.Description: The IP address of the Chia fullnode farmer this harvester will connect to. ANOTHER COMPUTER

worker_address.Name: worker_address
worker_address.Description: The IP address of this Unraid server on your LAN for controller/worker communication. THIS COMPUTER

mode.Name: mode
mode.Description: Default is 'harvester'.  If plotting as well, use 'harvester,plotter' and add a '/plotting' Path mount.

blockchains.Name: blockchains
blockchains.Description: Leave at 'chia'.  Only one, not multple.

appdata.Name: appdata
appdata.Description: Holds app data for the container. Not for temp plotting or final plot storage.

plots1.Name: plots1
plots1.Description: Holds completed plots for farming. Create more Paths for additional folders like plots1,plots2,etc...

Cleanarr.Name: Cleanarr
Cleanarr.Overview: A simple UI to help find and delete duplicate and sample files from your Plex server.

PLEX_TOKEN.Name: PLEX_TOKEN
PLEX_TOKEN.Description: (required) A valid Plex token for your Plex Server

LIBRARY_NAMES.Name: LIBRARY_NAMES
LIBRARY_NAMES.Description: (optional) Name(s) of your Plex Libraries to search. Separate multiple library names with

BYPASS_SSL_VERIFY.Name: BYPASS_SSL_VERIFY
BYPASS_SSL_VERIFY.Description: (optional) Disable SSL certificate verification. Use this if your Plex Server has

cncjs.Name: cncjs
cncjs.Overview: A full-featured web interface for CNC controllers running Grbl, Marlin, Smoothieware, or TinyG.

posterr.Name: posterr
posterr.Overview: Media display for Plex, sonarr and radarr

SpeedFlux.Name: SpeedFlux
SpeedFlux.Overview: This tool will continuosly run Speedtests at the chosen interval and export the data to InfluxDB. <br>

InfluxDB Address.Name: InfluxDB Address
InfluxDB Address.Description:
Container Variable: INFLUX_DB_ADDRESS
IP or Hostname of Influx DB

InfluxDB Database Name.Name: InfluxDB Database Name
InfluxDB Database Name.Description:
Container Variable: INFLUX_DB_DATABASE
If the database doesn't exist, it will be created.

Test Interval.Name: Test Interval
Test Interval.Description: How often should speed be tested, in minutes. Default is set at 2:30 as I like to see changes over time at different times of day.

InfluxDB Tags.value: isp, external_ip, server_id, server_name, server_location, speedtest_url
InfluxDB Tags.Name: InfluxDB Tags
InfluxDB Tags.Default: isp, external_ip, server_id, server_name, server_location, speedtest_url
InfluxDB Tags.Description: Tags to be added to the datasets. See https://github.com/breadlysm/speedtest-to-influxdb#tag-options. Tags must be comma seperated

Ping Interval.Name: Ping Interval
Ping Interval.Description: Interval is in seconds. This is how often your latency will be checked.

Ping Servers.Name: Ping Servers
Ping Servers.Description: hostnames or domains to use to test ping. On every ping interval, all servers input will be tested. Must be comma seperated.

(Optional) Server ID.Name: (Optional) Server ID
(Optional) Server ID.Description: Input a Ookla Speedtest server ID to use for your tests. This will use this server for every test.

Docker Registry.Name: Docker Registry
Docker Registry.Description:
Port for Docker Registry (if any), usually 5000

See README for setup.

Compressarr.Name: Compressarr
Compressarr.Overview: Compressarr is an application to take a filtered set of media from Radarr or (eventually) Sonarr and process it with customisable FFmpeg presets. It will even attempt to find the best settings for each video.

Branch.TagDescription: This is the Standard build, limited QSV hardware support, built to be small and light
This is the NVidia Ubuntu build, full Cuda support, built with the nightly FFmpeg and weighs in at 1.4GB

ElasticSearch5.Name: ElasticSearch-5
ElasticSearch5.Overview: Elasticsearch is a distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of solving a growing number of use cases. As the heart of the Elastic Stack, it centrally stores your data so you can discover the expected and uncover the unexpected.

nordvpn.Name: nordvpn
nordvpn.Overview: Official NordVPN client in a docker container; it makes routing traffic through the NordVPN network easy.

Location.Name: Location
Location.Description: [country]/[server]/[country_code]/[city]/[group] or [country] [city], if none provide you will connect to the recommended server.

DNS.Name: DNS
DNS.Description: Can set up to 3 DNS servers. For example 1.1.1.1,8.8.8.8 or Disable, Setting DNS disables CyberSec.

Technology.Name: Technology
Technology.Description: Specify Technology to use. NordLynx faster (but experimental).

CyberSEC.Name: CyberSEC
CyberSEC.Description: When enabled, the CyberSec feature will automatically block suspicious websites so that no malware or other cyber threats can infect your device.

LAN net.Name: LAN net
LAN net.Description: CIDR networks (IE 192.168.1.0/24), add a route to allows replies once the VPN is up.

Crafty.Name: Crafty
Crafty.Overview: An Appication to run all your minecraft servers From without a hustle.

Web UI Port.Name: Web UI Port
Web UI Port.Description: Port to connect to the Web UI

Minecraft Ports.Name: Minecraft Ports
Minecraft Ports.Description: Container Port: 25500-25600 yes, 100 ports for 100 possible Servers

Server-Files.Name: Server-Files
Server-Files.Description:
Minecraft server Files
Do not use this path in the web UI only use /minecraft_servers

Backups.Name: Backups
Backups.Description: Backup Folder (all of your backups and Crafty Controller Stuff)

Joomla.Name: Joomla
Joomla.Overview: Joomla is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) for publishing web content. It is built on a model–view–controller web application framework that can be used independently of the CMS. Joomla is written in PHP, uses object-oriented programming (OOP) techniques and software design patterns, stores data in a MySQL, MS SQL, or PostgreSQL database, and includes features such as page caching, RSS feeds, printable versions of pages, news flashes, blogs, search, and support for language internationalization.

mysql database host.Name: mysql database host
mysql database host.Description: mysql type database host for your joomla content

Database Name.Name: Database Name
Database Name.Description:
Name of the joomla database
If non existing it wil be created on startup, as long as the specified user has rights to do so

flame.Name: flame
flame.Overview: Flame is self-hosted startpage for your server. Easily manage your apps and bookmarks with built-in editors.

snippetbox.Name: snippet-box
snippetbox.Overview: Snippet Box is a simple self-hosted app for organizing your code snippets. It allows you to easily create, edit, browse and manage your snippets in various languages.

SignTools.Name: SignTools
SignTools.Overview: A self-hosted, cross-platform service to sign and install iOS apps, all without a computer.

Companion.Name: Companion
Companion.Overview: Unofficial image of Bitfocus companion, update to latest stable once a month.

Deduper.Name: Deduper
Deduper.Overview: Deduper is a Python script bundled into a Docker container that automatically deletes any files with the same content, regardless of name. This is done based off of the SHA512 hash.

Scan Directory.Name: Scan Directory
Scan Directory.Description: The directory for the program to dedupe.

audiobookshelf.Name: audiobookshelf
audiobookshelf.Overview: Audiobook manager and player. Saves your progress, supports multiple accounts, stream all audio formats on the fly. No more switching between dozens of audio files for a single audiobook, Audiobookshelf shows you one audio track with skipping, seeking and adjustable playback speed. Free & open source mobile apps under construction, consider contributing by posting feedback, suggestions, feature requests on github or the forums.

fotosho.Name: fotosho
fotosho.Overview: *BETA* Fotosho is a photo gallery for your home server. Organize your photos into albums internally and view as a slideshow. Free and open source. Does not require a database. Does not move, copy or modify your photos.

OPENVPN_IPV6.Name: OPENVPN_IPV6
OPENVPN_IPV6.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable tunneling of IPv6 (only for Mullvad)

OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG.Name: OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG
OPENVPN_CUSTOM_CONFIG.Description: OPTIONAL: The path to your OpenVPN configuration file. This implies VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom

OPENVPN_INTERFACE.Name: OPENVPN_INTERFACE
OPENVPN_INTERFACE.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom network interface name to use

OPENVPN_PORT.Name: OPENVPN_PORT
OPENVPN_PORT.Description: OPTIONAL: Custom OpenVPN server endpoint port to use

WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY.Name: WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY
WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY.Description: OPTINAL: 32 bytes private key in base64 format

WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY.Name: WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY
WIREGUARD_PRESHARED_KEY.Description: OPTINAL: 32 bytes pre-shared key in base64 format

WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY.Name: WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY
WIREGUARD_PUBLIC_KEY.Description: Only for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom and VPN_TYPE=wireguard: Wireguard server public key

WIREGUARD_ADDRESS.Name: WIREGUARD_ADDRESS
WIREGUARD_ADDRESS.Description: Wireguard IP network in the format xx.xx.xx.xx/xx. Wireguard interface address, only required if VPN_TYPE=wireguard. Note this is usually specific by user and the same for all servers.

WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_IP.Name: WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_IP
WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_IP.Description: Only for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom and VPN_TYPE=wireguard: Wireguard server endpoint IP address

WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_PORT.Name: WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_PORT
WIREGUARD_ENDPOINT_PORT.Description: OPTIONAL (required for VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=custom): Wireguard custom server endpoint port to use

WIREGUARD_INTERFACE.Name: WIREGUARD_INTERFACE
WIREGUARD_INTERFACE.Description: OPTIONAL: Specify a custom network interface name to use

REGION.Name: REGION
REGION.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN regions. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

COUNTRY.Name: COUNTRY
COUNTRY.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN countries. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

CITY.Name: CITY
CITY.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of VPN cities. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

SERVER_HOSTNAME.Name: SERVER_HOSTNAME
SERVER_HOSTNAME.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of server hostnames. https://github.com/qdm12/gluetun/wiki

FIREWALL.Name: FIREWALL
FIREWALL.Description: Turn on or off the container built-in firewall. You should turn off for debugging purposes only.

FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS.Name: FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS
FIREWALL_VPN_INPUT_PORTS.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow from the VPN server side (useful for vyprvpn port forwarding)

FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS.Name: FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS
FIREWALL_INPUT_PORTS.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of ports to allow through the default interface. This seems needed for Unraid containers and Kubernetes sidecars.

FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS.Name: FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS
FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS.Description: OPTIONAL: You first need to set your LAN CIDR in FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS. For example with FIREWALL_OUTBOUND_SUBNETS=192.168.1.0/24

FIREWALL_DEBUG.Name: FIREWALL_DEBUG
FIREWALL_DEBUG.Description: OPTIONAL: Prints every firewall related command. You should use it for debugging purposes only.

HEALTH_SERVER_ADDRESS.Name: HEALTH_SERVER_ADDRESS
HEALTH_SERVER_ADDRESS.Description: OPTIONAL: Internal Health Server Listening Addroess

HEALTH_ADDRESS_TO_PING.Name: HEALTH_ADDRESS_TO_PING
HEALTH_ADDRESS_TO_PING.Description: OPTIONAL: Address used to check tunnel health

HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_INITIAL.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_INITIAL
HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_INITIAL.Description: OPTIONAL: Initial health check duration in seconds.

HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_ADDITION.Name: HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_ADDITION
HEALTH_VPN_DURATION_ADDITION.Description: OPTIONAL: Subsequent health check duration in seconds.

DOT.Name: DOT
DOT.Description: (Recommended: on) Activate DNS over TLS with Unbound

DOT_PROVIDERS.Name: DOT_PROVIDERS
DOT_PROVIDERS.Description: Comma delimited list of DNS over TLS providers

DOT_PRIVATE_ADDRESS.Name: DOT_PRIVATE_ADDRESS
DOT_PRIVATE_ADDRESS.Description: All private CIDRs ranges. Comma separated list of CIDRs or single IP addresses Unbound won't resolve to. Note that the default setting prevents DNS rebinding

BLOCK_MALICIOUS.Name: BLOCK_MALICIOUS
BLOCK_MALICIOUS.Description: OPTIONAL: Block malicious hostnames and IPs with Unbound

BLOCK_SURVEILLANCE.Name: BLOCK_SURVEILLANCE
BLOCK_SURVEILLANCE.Description: OPTIONAL: Block surveillance hostnames and IPs with Unbound

BLOCK_ADS.Name: BLOCK_ADS
BLOCK_ADS.Description: OPTIONAL: Block ads hostnames and IPs with Unbound

UNBLOCK.Name: UNBLOCK
UNBLOCK.Description: OPTIONAL: Comma separated list of domain names to leave unblocked with Unbound. i.e. domain1.com,x.domain2.co.uk

DNS_UPDATE_PERIOD.Name: DNS_UPDATE_PERIOD
DNS_UPDATE_PERIOD.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update block lists and cryptographic files and restart Unbound. Set to 0 to deactivate updates. i.e. 0, 30s, 5m, 24h

DNS_PLAINTEXT_ADDRESS.Name: DNS_PLAINTEXT_ADDRESS
DNS_PLAINTEXT_ADDRESS.Description: OPTIONAL: IP address to use as DNS resolver if DOT is off

DNS_KEEP_NAMESERVER.Name: DNS_KEEP_NAMESERVER
DNS_KEEP_NAMESERVER.Description: OPTIONAL: Keep the nameservers in /etc/resolv.conf untouched, but disabled DNS blocking features

HTTPPROXY.Name: HTTPPROXY
HTTPPROXY.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal HTTP proxy

HTTPPROXY_USER.Name: HTTPPROXY_USER
HTTPPROXY_USER.Description: OPTIONAL: Username to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD.Name: HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD
HTTPPROXY_PASSWORD.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to the HTTP proxy

ENABLE_HTTPPROXY_STEALTH.Name: ENABLE_HTTPPROXY_STEALTH
ENABLE_HTTPPROXY_STEALTH.Description: OPTIONAL: Stealth mode means HTTP proxy headers are not added to your requests

SHADOWSOCKS.Name: SHADOWSOCKS
SHADOWSOCKS.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable the internal Shadowsocks proxy

SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS
SHADOWSOCKS_LISTENING_ADDRESS.Description: OPTIONAL: Port number for the HTTP proxy to listen on

SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD
SHADOWSOCKS_PASSWORD.Description: OPTIONAL: Password to use to connect to Shadowsocks

SHADOWSOCKS_CIPHER.Name: SHADOWSOCKS_CIPHER
SHADOWSOCKS_CIPHER.Description: OPTIONAL: Cipher to use for Shadowsocks

UPDATER_PERIOD.Name: UPDATER_PERIOD
UPDATER_PERIOD.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to update all VPN servers information in memory and to /gluetun/servers.json. Set to 0 to disable. This does a burst of DNS over TLS requests, which may be blocked if you set BLOCK_MALICIOUS=on for example. Valid duration string such as 24h.

PUBLICIP_FILE.Name: PUBLICIP_FILE
PUBLICIP_FILE.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

PUBLICIP_PERIOD.Name: PUBLICIP_PERIOD
PUBLICIP_PERIOD.Description: OPTIONAL: Period to check for public IP address. Set to 0 to disable.

VERSION_INFORMATION.Name: VERSION_INFORMATION
VERSION_INFORMATION.Description: OPTIONAL: Filepath to store the public IP address assigned

HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG.Name: HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG
HTTP_CONTROL_SERVER_LOG.Description: OPTIONAL: Enable logging of HTTP requests

ShadowSocksServer.Name: ShadowSocks-Server
ShadowSocksServer.Overview: Shadowsocks is a tunneling proxy developed to be free, open-source, and mainly used by Chinese people to bypass the Great Firewall restrictions. While using, it covers your browser traffic only, and it is almost impossible to detect and block it.

URL.Description: URL that other sites can access this container at.

machineboxfacebox.Name: machinebox-facebox
machineboxfacebox.Overview: With this container you have all possible settings available[br]

MB_PORT.Name: MB_PORT
MB_PORT.Description: (string) Defaults to 8080 - Port where the service will listen.

MB_ADDRESS.Name: MB_ADDRESS
MB_ADDRESS.Description: - (string) Defaults to 0.0.0.0 - Address where the service will listen.

MB_FACEBOX_REDIS_DB.Name: MB_FACEBOX_REDIS_DB
MB_FACEBOX_REDIS_DB.Description: Redis DB - (string) Optional Redis database to connect to.

MB_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_SECONDS.Name: MB_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_SECONDS
MB_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_SECONDS.Description: (integer) Default to 60. Timeout in seconds that Facebox will use when it downloads files, for example to download the state file.

MB_FACEBOX_READ_ONLY.Name: MB_FACEBOX_READ_ONLY
MB_FACEBOX_READ_ONLY.Description: (bool) Defaults to false - If true Facebox will be read only. Teaching and updating state will be disabled. Be sure to provide MB_FACEBOX_STATE_URL to set the initial state, otherwise the box will be useless.

MB_FACEBOX_INDEX_REFRESH_SECONDS.Name: MB_FACEBOX_INDEX_REFRESH_SECONDS
MB_FACEBOX_INDEX_REFRESH_SECONDS.Description: (integer) Defaults to 2 - Number of seconds that Facebox will wait to update the index for new data, or changes in the data. Facebox will accumulate changes to perform an update on the search index, because changes are an expensive operation, with this variable you can adjust the time interval for that operation.

MB_FACEBOX_DISABLE_RECOGNITION.Name: MB_FACEBOX_DISABLE_RECOGNITION
MB_FACEBOX_DISABLE_RECOGNITION.Description: (bool) Defaults to false - If you only need face detection, the recognition algorithms can be disabled by setting this variable to true, saving resources. If you disable recognition, the teaching endpoinds will be disabled as well.

MB_BASICAUTH_USER.Name: MB_BASICAUTH_USER
MB_BASICAUTH_USER.Description: (string) The Basic Authentication username and password that every request must use. Recommended for sitautions where the boxes are publicly accessible.

MB_BASICAUTH_PASS.Name: MB_BASICAUTH_PASS
MB_BASICAUTH_PASS.Description: (string) The Basic Authentication username and password that every request must use. Recommended for sitautions where the boxes are publicly accessible

MB_FACEBOX_REDIS.Name: MB_FACEBOX_REDIS
MB_FACEBOX_REDIS.Description: - (string) Redis host and port for example my_redis:6379. If this option is present Facebox state will be synced by Redis,

MB_FACEBOX_STATE_URL.Name: MB_FACEBOX_STATE_URL
MB_FACEBOX_STATE_URL.Description: (string) URL to a .facebox state file to initialize the box with. Useful for spinning up many instances of Facebox with the same state.

MB_FACEBOX_STATE_POLL_SECONDS.Name: MB_FACEBOX_STATE_POLL_SECONDS
MB_FACEBOX_STATE_POLL_SECONDS.Description: (integer) Default to 0 (No polling). If this variable is set, Facebox would poll the MB_FACEBOX_STATE_URL for changes on the file, based on the ETag or Last-Modified http headers. If the file changes Facebox will download the new file and update the state of the teaching. This variable is useful for updating multiple running instances of Facebox.

MB_DISABLE_CORS.Name: MB_DISABLE_CORS
MB_DISABLE_CORS.Description: (bool) Defaults to false - If true will turn off CORS support for the box.

machineboxtagbox.Name: machinebox-tagbox
machineboxtagbox.Overview: Tagbox lets you identify the content of images by getting a list of ordered tags.

MB_PORT.Name: MB_PORT
MB_PORT.Description: (string) Defaults to 8080 - Port where the service will listen.

MB_ADDRESS.Name: MB_ADDRESS
MB_ADDRESS.Description: (string) Defaults to 0.0.0.0 - Address where the service will listen.

MB_TAGBOX_READ_ONLY.Name: MB_TAGBOX_READ_ONLY
MB_TAGBOX_READ_ONLY.Description: (bool) Defaults to false - If true Tagbox will be read only. Teaching and updating state will be disabled. Be sure to provide MB_TAGBOX_STATE_URL to set the initial state, otherwise the box will be useless.

MB_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_SECONDS.Name: MB_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_SECONDS
MB_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_SECONDS.Description: (integer) Default to 60. Timeout in seconds that Tagbox will use when it downloads files, for example to download the state file.

API_KEY.Name: API_KEY
API_KEY.Description:
Container Variable: MB_KEY
Get one here https://machinebox.io/login

MB_DISABLE_CORS.Name: MB_DISABLE_CORS
MB_DISABLE_CORS.Description: (bool) Defaults to false - If true will turn off CORS support for the box.

MB_BASICAUTH_USER.Name: MB_BASICAUTH_USER
MB_BASICAUTH_USER.Description: (string) The Basic Authentication username and password that every request must use. Recommended for sitautions where the boxes are publicly accessible.

MB_TAGBOX_STATE_URL.Name: MB_TAGBOX_STATE_URL
MB_TAGBOX_STATE_URL.Description: (string) URL to a .tagbox state file to initialize the box with. Useful for spinning up many instances of Tagbox with the same state.

MB_TAGBOX_STATE_POLL_SECONDS.Name: MB_TAGBOX_STATE_POLL_SECONDS
MB_TAGBOX_STATE_POLL_SECONDS.Description: (integer) Default to 0 (No polling). If this variable is set, Tagbox would poll the MB_TAGBOX_STATE_URL for changes on the file, based on the ETag or Last-Modified http headers. If the file changes Tagbox will download the new file and update the state of the teaching. This variable is useful for updating multiple running instances of Tagbox.

MB_TAGBOX_INDEX_REFRESH_SECONDS.Name: MB_TAGBOX_INDEX_REFRESH_SECONDS
MB_TAGBOX_INDEX_REFRESH_SECONDS.Description: (integer) Defaults to 2 - Number of seconds that Tagbox will wait to update the index for new data, or changes in the data. Tagbox will accumulate changes to perform an update on the search index, because changes are an expensive operation, with this variable you can adjust the time interval for that operation.

SkyFactoryOne.Name: SkyFactoryOne
SkyFactoryOne.Overview: SkyFactory One Modded Minecraft Server[br]The new ultimate skyblock modpack! Watch development at: darkosto.tv/SkyFactoryOneLive[br]It's skyblock like you've never seen it before... Or have you?! High tech mods, automation, and spawning in the void with nothing but a tree and a single piece of dirt between you and certain death![br]SkyFactory® One is a modernization of the original SkyFactory for Minecraft 1.6.4. The goal of this project is to remain true to the original modpack while updating features and mods to 1.16.5. Find yourself sieving for resources, twerk for trees, decorate your trophy room, exploring a deep, dark dimension, and much more! Many original mods have returned joined by several new and updated mods! And what would SkyFactory be without ForceCraft, a reconstruction of the original DartCraft mod.[br]SkyFactory One delivers a nostalgic experience with the quality of life upgrades to make it even more exciting! If you've never played SkyFactory before, prepare for a fresh experience in a modded skyblock. The original can never be replaced, but we can sure try!

KitchenOwl.Name: KitchenOwl
KitchenOwl.Overview: KitchenOwl Backend Server for use with the Mobile App. If you want a WebUI, you should also Install the KitchenOwl-Web Container. KitchenOwl is a self-hosted grocery list and recipe manager. The backend is made with Flask and the frontend with Flutter. Easily add items to your shopping list before you go shopping. You can also create recipes and add items based on what you want to cook.

Path /data.Name: Path /data
Path /data.Description: This is where the KitchenOwl Database is stored.

KitchenOwlWeb.Name: KitchenOwl-Web
KitchenOwlWeb.Overview: This is the WebUI for the KitchenOwl Container. You will also need the KitchenOwl Container for this to work. KitchenOwl is a self-hosted grocery list and recipe manager. The backend is made with Flask and the frontend with Flutter. Easily add items to your shopping list before you go shopping. You can also create recipes and add items based on what you want to cook.

Url to the Backend (needs kitchenowl con.Name: Url to the Backend (needs kitchenowl container)
Url to the Backend (needs kitchenowl con.Description: Url to the Backend (needs kitchenowl container)

obsdocker.Name: obs-docker
obsdocker.Overview: This is a container for running OBS applications completely inside a Docker container. You do not need to forward your running XAuth or allow Docker to draw onto your display. Nor do you need to use SSH to forward X11. This container exposes a VNC webclient to the host and therefore everything is contained within the container.

hyperionng.Name: hyperion.ng
hyperionng.Overview: Hyperion is an opensource Bias or Ambient Lighting implementation which you might know from TV manufacturers. It supports many LED devices and video grabbers.

curanovnc.Name: cura-novnc

mailgunlogger.Overview: MailgunLogger is a simple admin tool that uses the Mailgun API to retrieves events on a regular basis from Mailgun - who only provide a limited time of event storage - and stores them inside a MySQL database.

pixelservtls.Name: pixelserv-tls
pixelservtls.Overview: pixelserv-tls is a tiny bespoke HTTP/1.1 webserver with HTTPS and SNI support. It acts on behalf of hundreds of thousands of advert/tracker servers and responds to all requests with nothing to speed up web browsing.

qbittorrentfilebot.Name: qbittorrent-filebot
qbittorrentfilebot.Overview: qBittorrent is a cross-platform free and open-source BitTorrent client. It is a native application written in C++. It uses Boost, Qt 5 toolkit, and the libtorrent-rasterbar library (for the torrent back-end). Its optional search engine is written in Python.

CONTAINER_PORT_MAPPING.Description: Must exist and be same as webgui_port in case u dont use a dedicated ip
